description: An n8n workflow that sets up POST and GET webhooks to receive requests, extracts Adobe Sign client ID from headers, processes the response to retrieve agreement details (ID, participants, status) using JavaScript Function and Set nodes. Uses n8n webhook nodes and custom code.

name: SIGNL4 Alert Notification Trigger
description: This n8n workflow sends a test alert message to the SIGNL4 incident alerting service via its API when manually triggered. It uses n8n's Manual Trigger node linked to the SIGNL4 node for sending alerts with customizable titles and messages.

name: n8n Error Trigger Webhook Extractor
description: This n8n workflow uses the Error Trigger node to catch errors, then calls n8n's internal API to get execution details, and runs custom JavaScript to extract webhook payload data from the workflow execution. It automates error context retrieval using n8n API and JavaScript.

name: Download PDF via Webhook
description: This n8n workflow sets up a webhook that, upon an HTTP GET request, downloads a specific PDF file from Deutsche Bahn's website using HTTP Request node and responds with the PDF as an attachment, leveraging n8n's webhook and HTTP request capabilities.

name: Send Message on Twake
description: Automates sending messages to a Twake channel using the Twake API. Triggered manually via n8n, it posts content into specified channels, ideal for team communication integration and workflow automation.

name: Date & Time Manipulation Tutorial
description: An n8n workflow demonstrating date-time operations using n8n DateTime and Set nodes with Luxon expressions. It shows how to calculate, format, and convert dates for automation purposes without external APIs.

name: Download and Split Binary Files Workflow
description: An n8n workflow that downloads a ZIP file via HTTP request, decompresses it, and splits the contained binary files into individual items. Uses HTTP Request, Compression, and Function nodes. Ideal for processing bulk file archives automatically.

name: QuestDB Table Creation & Data Insertion
description: An n8n workflow that creates a table and inserts data into QuestDB using manual trigger, Set node, and QuestDB node for SQL execution and data insertion.

name: Download and Save File to Host
description: An n8n workflow that downloads an image from a URL using HTTP Request node and saves it locally using Write Binary File node, triggered manually. Useful for automating file retrieval and storage on local machines.

name: Bubble API Data Fetcher
description: An n8n workflow that triggers a manual execution to fetch user data from Bubble.io's REST API using HTTP Header Authentication. Useful for integrating Bubble app data into automated processes.

name: Manual Trigger to Read JPG Files
description: An n8n workflow that manually triggers a process to read all .jpg files from the /data/lol/ directory using the Read Binary Files node. Useful for workflows requiring batch processing of image files on local storage.

name: Merge Greetings with Names by Language
description: An n8n workflow that combines sample datasets of names and greetings based on their language code. It uses JavaScript code nodes to provide data samples and a merge node to join them by 'language'. Useful for basic multi-language greeting generation.

name: Simple Key Renaming Workflow
description: An n8n workflow triggered manually that sets a key-value pair and renames the key from 'key' to 'newkey'. Uses native n8n nodes: Manual Trigger, Set, and Rename Keys. Demonstrates basic data transformation within n8n.

name: RSS Feed Trigger Workflow
description: An n8n workflow that triggers on manual execution and reads an RSS feed from https://failedmachine.com/rss/. Uses n8n's Manual Trigger and RSS Feed Read nodes to fetch and process RSS data for automation.

name: MySQL Table Setup and Insert Demo
description: n8n workflow creating a MySQL table 'test', inserting a row with id and name using MySQL node and Set node, triggered manually. Demonstrates basic MySQL operations automation in n8n with MySQL credentials.

name: Sequential API Requests with ReqRes
description: An n8n workflow automating sequential HTTP calls to the ReqRes API: GET users, POST to create a user, and PATCH to update a user. Demonstrates chaining of REST API requests using n8n’s Manual Trigger and HTTP Request nodes for testing and learning API interactions.

name: SSE Stream Listener
description: An n8n workflow that listens to Server-Sent Events (SSE) from a specified URL using the built-in SSE Trigger node. Useful for real-time event streaming and automation based on live web data.

name: Create Array from Mock Data Items
description: An n8n workflow that generates mock JSON data objects and consolidates them into a single array object using JavaScript functions inside n8n. Useful for testing and prototyping data handling workflows without external APIs.

name: CSV Spreadsheet Reader
description: An n8n workflow that reads a CSV spreadsheet file from local storage using the Read Binary File and Spreadsheet File nodes to parse and process data on manual trigger.

name: Spotify Track Fetcher
description: An n8n workflow that retrieves detailed data for a specific Spotify track using Spotify's OAuth2 API upon manual execution.

name: Batch Loop with Conditional Stop
description: An n8n workflow that generates 10 items, processes them one by one in batches of size 1, and conditionally stops the loop after the 6th item. Uses core n8n nodes: Manual Trigger, Function, SplitInBatches, IF condition, and Set to signal loop end.

name: Local DateTime Retrieval Workflow
description: This n8n workflow uses a manual trigger and a function node with moment.js to fetch and format the current local datetime based on an environment timezone variable. It outputs detailed datetime components for flexible usage.

name: Spanish Text Case and Replace Demo
description: n8n workflow demonstrating string manipulations like toLowerCase, toUpperCase and replace on Spanish text using executeCommand nodes triggered manually. Ideal for beginners learning text processing in n8n with simple command line snippets.

name: Manual Date Parser
description: An n8n workflow that triggers manually and converts a specified date string ('14/02/2020') into a date object using n8n's Date & Time node. Useful for beginners learning to handle date parsing and transformations without external APIs.

name: Manual Trigger to Read Local Binary File
description: An n8n workflow that manually triggers the reading of a local binary file (e.g., image) from a specified path using the built-in Read Binary File node. Useful for workflows involving local file processing.

name: Sum USD Amounts from Mock Data
description: An n8n workflow that sums USD amounts from mocked JSON data using Function nodes. It manually triggers, generates sample amounts, and calculates their total. Utilizes n8n core nodes without external APIs. Ideal for simple data aggregation demonstrations.

name: Trigger Folder Access in Box
description: This n8n workflow triggers manually and connects to the Box API via OAuth2 to access metadata of a specific folder named 'n8n-rocks'. It demonstrates basic integration of manual trigger and Box cloud storage for folder resource retrieval.

name: Quickstart Demo: Customer Data Fetch & Format
description: An introductory n8n workflow demonstrating how to fetch fake customer data from the n8nTrainingCustomerDatastore node, then transform and map it into cleaner fields using the Set node. Uses manual trigger for testing. Great for beginners learning API data extraction and manipulation.

name: JSON File Creator from Data Object
description: This n8n workflow generates example JSON data, converts it to a binary buffer, encodes it in base64, and writes it to a local JSON file using built-in function and file nodes. Useful for simple data export automation without external APIs.

name: Standup Bot Config Reader
description: n8n workflow that reads a JSON configuration file for a Standup Bot from the local filesystem and converts it to JSON format for further processing. Uses n8n's File and Move Binary Data nodes to trigger and handle config data reading and parsing.

name: Standup Bot Config Override
description: An n8n workflow to manually update and save the Standup Bot configuration by converting JSON to binary and writing it to a local file. Utilizes n8n built-in nodes: Manual Trigger, Move Binary Data, and Write Binary File.

name: Redis Key-Value Retrieval Trigger
description: An n8n workflow that triggers manually and retrieves the value of a specified Redis key using Redis API. Uses n8n's Manual Trigger and Redis nodes to fetch the value of key 'hello' from a Redis instance.

name: Get Today's Date and Weekday
description: An n8n workflow using a Manual Trigger and Function node to output the current ISO date and weekday name in JavaScript. Useful for initiating date-based automation or logging within n8n without external API calls.

name: Command Output Parsing and Conditional Check
description: An n8n workflow that executes a shell command returning JSON, parses the output, transforms it into flow data, and conditionally branches using an IF node based on parsed boolean value. Utilizes Execute Command, Function Item, and IF nodes.

name: Conditional Close Date Setter
description: n8n workflow to set or validate a 'Close Date'. Uses manual trigger, regex check, and date handling to either retain an original fixed date or update it to 3 weeks from today. Employs built-in n8n nodes only, for date automation tasks.

name: Simple API Endpoint for Google Search URL
description: Creates a lightweight API using n8n with Webhook and Respond to Webhook nodes that generates a Google search URL from query parameters (first and last names). Perfect for beginners learning to create API endpoints. Tech stack: n8n workflow, HTTP webhook.

name: Scheduled Discord Meme Poster
description: An n8n workflow that automates posting memes to Discord channels using Discord Webhooks, triggered by cron schedules set for specific weekdays and intervals. It leverages n8n's Cron and Discord nodes to send customized memes on Wednesdays, Fridays, and every 30 minutes.

name: Discord Message Sender
description: Simple n8n workflow sending a 'Hello World!' message to a Discord channel via webhook API. Triggered manually, it demonstrates basic Discord integration using n8n's built-in Discord node and webhook URI.

name: Simple XML to JSON Conversion
description: An n8n workflow that converts a hardcoded XML string to JSON format using the built-in XML node. Ideal for learning XML parsing in n8n. Uses n8n core nodes: Manual Trigger, Set, and XML parsing nodes.

name: AWS SNS Test Message Sender
description: An n8n workflow that sends a test message to an AWS SNS topic using a manual trigger. It integrates n8n with AWS SNS API to automate notification sending for testing or alerting purposes.

name: Manual Trigger MongoDB Data Inserter
description: An n8n workflow triggered manually to insert predefined key-value data into a MongoDB collection. Utilizes n8n's Manual Trigger, Set, and MongoDB nodes for simple data insertion tasks.

name: Assign Variables Using Set Node
description: A simple n8n workflow demonstrating how to assign values to variables of different types (number, string, boolean) using the Set node triggered manually. Ideal for beginners learning value assignment in n8n automation.

name: Manual Trigger with Crypto Node Demo
description: This n8n workflow demonstrates a manual trigger that executes a Crypto node to process a simple string ('n8n rocks!'). It uses n8n's built-in manual trigger and crypto encryption tools for basic cryptographic operations. Ideal for learning node chaining and crypto usage.

name: Basic Conditional Workflow Demo
description: An n8n workflow demonstrating manual trigger, creation of test data, conditional branching based on 'id' field, and setting different string values. Uses n8n native nodes: Manual Trigger, Function, IF condition, and Set nodes for flow control and data assignment.

name: Manual Trigger to Execute Workflow
description: A simple n8n workflow that uses a manual trigger node to initiate the execution of another predefined workflow by its ID. Utilizes n8n's internal executeWorkflow node to chain workflows. Ideal for manual control and testing purposes.

name: ID-Based Conditional Set Workflow
description: An n8n workflow using manual trigger, function, and switch nodes to map IDs (0,1,2) to specific string values (n8n, nodemation, nathan). It demonstrates conditional branching and data transformation without external APIs.

name: Basic Array Mapper Workflow
description: Simple n8n workflow using Function nodes to generate mock array data and map each element into individual JSON objects. Demonstrates basic data transformation without external APIs or integrations.

name: Create JSON Items from Mock Data
description: An n8n workflow that generates a mock list of user objects and converts them into individual JSON items using Function nodes. Useful for testing or prototyping JSON data processing without external APIs.
